newsitem.title: JAPAN: Moody's assigns Baa2 to STB Cayman Capital's notes.
newsitem.headline: Moody's assigns Baa2 to STB Cayman Capital's notes.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Monday it had assigned its Baa2 rating to STB Cayman Capital Ltd's 100 billion yen worth of mandatory exchangeable subordinated guaranteed notes due in 2007.
In assigning the rating, Moody's said it took into account the strength of parent company Sumitomo Trust & Banking Co Ltd's guarantee.
STB Cayman Capital, a wholly owned subsidiary of Sumitomo Trust, was formed recently for the sole purpose of issuing the notes on behalf of Sumitomo Trust, Moody's said in a statement.
Sumitomo Trust provides an unconditional guarantee on a subordinated basis to payment of principal in interest, Moody's said.
